title: Automate enabling non-autoenabled special remotes
body:
Hello. I am testing the 0.13.0rc1.

I have a very odd use case for datalad where I must stage *most* of the available datalad repo on our staging server. 

When I run `datalad install -r` on some dataset, I see a lot of this warning.

```
install(ok): /mnt/scratch/datalad-test/datasets.datalad.org/conp-dataset/projects/Khanlab/BigBrainHippoUnfold (dataset)                                                                                                    
[INFO   ] access to 1 dataset sibling s3-PRIVATE not auto-enabled, enable with:                              
|               datalad siblings -d "/mnt/scratch/datalad-test/datasets.datalad.org/conp-dataset/projects/visual-working-memory" enable -s s3-PRIVATE
  [25 similar messages have been suppressed] 
```

I know that I need to enable s3-PRIVATE or I won't be able to do `datalad get`. Is there a way to auto-enable s3-PRIVATE on all such repository when datalad encounters it? I don't quite understand the meaning of s3-PRIVATE, but is there a way to globally enable this for all sub-modules?
